forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content: Does anybody know how to select the USB port/hard disk to boot from when there are for example two USB hard disks plugged ? Pressing "u" at PLoP screen seems to select a random port to boot from.

forumNotes.author: Icecube
forumNotes.content:
```
u	  Boot USB

	press SHIFT to force USB 1.1

	press CTRL to wait for a keypress before starting the operating system. You have here the option to press "n" (next) and continue the search for mass storage devices to boot from another usb device
```

[http://www.plop.at/e...er.html#hotkeys](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html#hotkeys "External link")

forumNotes.author: ktp
forumNotes.content:
> [http://www.plop.at/e...er.html#hotkeys](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanager.html#hotkeys "External link")

Thank you.  

I had problem since I used an external keyboard/mouse through an USB hub, which is not supported by PLoP. Otherwise even with the internal keyboard, I have to press "Ctrl" before pressing 'u' in order to get the prompt for pressing "n" for searching for USB device. It is weird since as if you have to press Ctrl-U. Afterwards the 'n' key works well, and from the USB device (manufacturer name) I can get to boot the correct USB key.  

Note : this key is not detected by BIOS at boot time, so thanks to PLoP I can even boot from it, otherwise it would be impossible.
